title: Nvidia sheds $279 billion in market cap: reasons behind the fall
description: Nvidia's market capitalisation stood at $2.65 trillion after Tuesday’s close. Shares of Nvidia have been on a decline over the last week, delivering a negative 13.65% return over the five-day period.
content: Shares of chip heavyweight Nvidia tumbled 9.53% on Tuesday, as investors questioned artificial intelligence (AI) optimism. Nvidia’s market capitalisation declined by $279 billion, marking the steepest single-day fall for a US company.The company’s market capitalisation stood at $2.65 trillion after Tuesday’s close. Shares of Nvidia have been on a decline over the last week, delivering a negative 13.65% return over the five-day period.A look at what’s driving the steep decline in Nvidia’s share price:US antitrust probeThe US Department of Justice has sent a subpoena (legally binding request) to Nvidia as it probes the company for antitrust practices. Officials are concerned that the chipmaker is making it harder to switch to other suppliers and penalizes buyers that do not exclusively use its AI chips. The DoJ launched a probe after receiving complaints from competitors that Nvidia had abused its market dominance.
